item.title: 美联储尚未 "落后于形势" :Mike Dolan
item.description: 美联储降息可能晚了一些，但在防止美国经济衰退方面尚未落后。【原文：The Federal Reserve may be a bit late cutting interest rates, but it's not yet behind the curve in forestalling a U.S. recession.】

item.title: 装瓶商可口可乐公司（Coca-Cola HBC）上调 2024 年收入和营业利润预期
item.description: 装瓶商可口可乐公司（Coca-Cola HBC）周三上调了其年度营业利润和收入预期，该瑞士集团上半年收入增加，得益于其采取措施减轻高通胀和汇率波动的影响。【原文：Bottler Coca-Cola HBC boosted its annual operating profit and revenue forecast on Wednesday, as the Swiss group posted higher first-half revenue, helped by its measures to mitigate the impact of high inflation and currency fluctuations.】

item.title: 马士基认为全球需求将持续，但增速将放缓
item.description: 船运公司马士基周三表示，全球集装箱需求预计在未来几个季度仍将保持积极态势，尽管增长速度可能会放缓，但该公司同时警告称，巨大的风险依然存在。【原文：Shipping company Maersk on Wednesday said global container demand is expected to remain positive in the coming quarters, though likely growing at a slower pace, while it also warning that substantial risks persisted.】

item.title: 索尼第一季度利润增长 10%，得益于图像传感器的强劲表现
item.description: 索尼公司周三公布，受其行业领先的图像传感器业务的推动，公司 4-6 月份的营业利润增长了 10%，超过了分析师的预期。【原文：Sony on Wednesday booked a 10% rise in operating profit in the April-June quarter, beating analyst estimates, boosted by the strength of its industry-leading image sensor business.】

item.title: 本田第一季度利润增长 23%，得益于混合动力汽车的销售
item.description: 日本本田汽车公司（Honda Motor）周三公布的第一季度利润增长了 23%，原因是该公司受益于日元走软、价格上涨以及在美国和本土市场混合动力汽车销量的增长。【原文：Japan's Honda Motor reported a 23% increase in first-quarter profit on Wednesday as the automaker benefited from a weaker yen, higher pricing and growing hybrid vehicle sales in the U.S. and its home market.】

item.title: 彪马下调财年核心利润预期
item.description: 德国运动服制造商彪马周三收窄了对全年核心利润的展望，理由是预计运费将上涨，以及消费者情绪持续低迷，尤其是在中国。【原文：German sportswear maker Puma on Wednesday narrowed down its outlook for full-year core profit, citing expected higher freight costs and continued muted consumer sentiment, especially in China.】

item.title: 沙特阿美斥资 7.02 亿美元从住友化学购买石化合资公司股份
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）与日本住友化学公司（Sumitomo Chemical）周三在一份联合声明中表示，两家公司已同意以 7.02 亿美元的价格向日本住友化学公司购买其石化合资企业 Petro Rabigh 22.5% 的股份。【原文：Saudi Aramco has agreed to buy from Japan's Sumitomo Chemical a 22.5% stake in their petrochemical joint venture Petro Rabigh for $702 million, the companies said in a joint statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: Glencore 在与投资者讨论后决定不分拆煤炭业务
item.description: Glencore 周三表示，在获得大多数投资者的支持后，该公司将不会分拆煤炭业务，因为在这家大宗商品巨头最近收购泰克资源公司（Teck Resources）的炼焦煤资产后，投资者们看到了化石燃料的丰厚收益。【原文：Glencore will not spin off its coal business after securing backing from the majority of its investors who see lucrative earnings from the fossil fuel after the commodities giant's recent acquisition of Teck Resources' coking coal assets, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 软银实现季度微利，公布 34 亿美元回购计划
item.description: 日本科技投资商软银集团（SoftBank Group）在 4-6 月份实现了小幅净利润，并公布了回购高达 34 亿美元股票的计划，以回应投资者要求获得更好回报的呼声。【原文：Japanese technology investor SoftBank Group swung to a small net profit in the April-June quarter and unveiled plans to buy back up to $3.4 billion in shares, answering investor calls for better returns.】

item.title: WPP 同意以 7.75 亿美元向 KKR 出售 FGS Global 股份
item.description: 英国广告集团 WPP 周三同意以 7.75 亿美元的价格将其在 FGS Global 的控股权出售给小股东 KKR，这意味着这家财经公关公司的企业价值为 17 亿美元。【原文：British ad group WPP on Wednesday agreed to sell its controlling stake in FGS Global to minority shareholder KKR for $775 million, implying an enterprise value for the financial PR agency of $1.7 billion.】

item.title: 尽管中国市场疲软，妮维雅制造商拜尔斯道夫的销售额仍在增长
item.description: 拜尔斯道夫（Beiersdorf）周三公布了半年销售额增长报告，其旗舰护肤品牌妮维雅（Nivea）实现了两位数的增长。【原文：Beiersdorf reported higher half-year sales on Wednesday, helped by double-digit percentage growth in its flagship skincare brand Nivea.】

item.title: 肥胖症药物制造商诺和诺德第二季度盈利预期不及预期
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）周三公布的第二季度营业利润低于预期，上调了 2024 年的销售预期，但下调了利润展望，因为在蓬勃发展的减肥药市场上，来自礼来公司（Eli Lilly）的竞争愈演愈烈。【原文：Novo Nordisk on Wednesday posted second-quarter operating profit below expectations, raised its 2024 sales forecast but cut profit outlook, as competition from Eli Lilly in the booming weight-loss drug market intensifies.】

item.title: 市场动荡考验岸田推动日本成为投资者之国的努力
item.description: 在东京股市创下自 1987 年以来最大跌幅的第二天，关谷由里决定是时候响应首相岸田文雄的长期呼吁，让日本公民将 15 万亿美元的家庭资产进行更多投资了。【原文：A day after the Tokyo stock market had its biggest fall since 1987, Yuri Sekiya decided it was time to heed Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's longstanding call for Japanese citizens to invest more of their $15 trillion in household assets.】

item.title: 荷兰银行第二季度净利息收入高于预期
item.description: 荷兰银行周三公布的第二季度净利息收入超出预期，得益于利率 "长期走高 "的环境。【原文：Dutch lender ABN Amro beat second-quarter net interest income expectations on Wednesday, benefiting from a "higher for longer" environment for interest rates.】

item.title: 德国商业银行寻求回购并确认前景，但利润下降
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank）周三表示，由于净利息收入下降，第二季度净利润下降了 4.8%，符合预期。【原文：Germany's Commerzbank said on Wednesday that net profit fell 4.8% in the second quarter, in line with expectations and as net interest income dipped.】

item.title: 早间竞价日本央行拯救世界
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu.】

item.title: 国泰航空将购买 30 架空中客车 A330-900 型飞机
item.description: 总部设在香港的国泰航空公司周三表示，将以约110亿美元的基本价格购买30架空客A330-900宽体飞机，并可选择再购买30架。【原文：Cathay Pacific will buy 30 Airbus A330-900 wide-body aircraft for a basic price of about $11 billion, with options to buy another 30, the Hong Kong-based airline said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，罗氏考虑剥离价值 19 亿美元的癌症数据初创公司
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，瑞士制药公司罗氏正在考虑剥离癌症数据专家 Flatiron Health。【原文：Swiss pharmaceutical company Roche is considering divesting cancer data specialist Flatiron Health, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新加坡星展银行第二季度净利润增长 4%，超出预期
item.description: 新加坡最大的银行星展集团周三公布，第二季度净利润同比增长4%，主要得益于总收入的增长，其中手续费收入创下历史新高。【原文：Singapore's biggest bank, DBS Group , posted on Wednesday a rise of 4% in second-quarter net profit from a year earlier, boosted by stronger total income, with fee income at a record high.】

item.title: 香港国泰航空宣布派发中期股息，利润下降 15
item.description: 国泰航空公司（Cathay Pacific Airways）周三宣布派发中期股息，称其上半年利润同比下降 15%，但业绩表现强劲。【原文：Cathay Pacific Airways on Wednesday declared an interim dividend citing a strong performance even as its first half profit dropped 15% from a year ago.】

item.title: 中国 7 月出口增速降至 3 个月低点，但进口稳健增长
item.description: 周三的海关数据显示，中国 7 月份出口同比增长 7.0%，增速低于 6 月份，为 4 月份以来最弱，但进口强劲增长 7.2%。【原文：China's exports climbed 7.0% in July from year earlier, a slower pace of growth than in June and the weakest since April, but imports rose at robust 7.2% rate, customs data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 泰国批准现代汽车 2,800 万美元的电动汽车投资
item.description: 泰国投资委员会周三表示，泰国已批准韩国现代汽车公司价值 10 亿泰铢（2800 万美元）的投资。【原文：Thailand has approved an investment worth 1 billion baht ($28 million) from South Korean auto maker Hyundai, the Board of Investment said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：中国恒大清算人对普华永道提起诉讼
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周二报道，陷入困境的地产巨头中国恒大集团的清算人已开始对普华永道会计师事务所提起法律诉讼，指控其在为该集团工作时存在 "疏忽 "和 "失实陈述"。【原文：Liquidators of troubled property giant China Evergrande Group have started legal action against PricewaterhouseCoopers, accusing it of "negligence" and "misrepresentation" in its work for the group, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 巴拿马政府为高达 90 亿美元的融资敞开大门
item.description: 巴拿马部长理事会在一份声明中说，巴拿马政府周二通过了两项法令，允许经济部寻求累计 90 亿美元的融资。【原文：Panama's government passed two decrees on Tuesday allowing the economy ministry to seek a cumulative $9 billion in financing, Panama's council of ministers said in a statement.】

item.title: 日本央行副行长称市场不稳定时不会加息
item.description: 日本央行（BOJ）副行长内田伸一周三表示，央行不会在金融市场不稳定时提高利率。【原文：Bank of Japan (BOJ) Deputy Governor Shinichi Uchida said on Wednesday the central bank won't raise interest rates when financial markets are unstable.】

item.title: 交易员考虑降息押注和利差因素，美元持稳，日元震荡
item.description: 周三，美元持稳，拖累日元脱离七个月高位，货币市场在本周恢复了平静。本周伊始，受经济衰退担忧和热门套息交易平仓的影响，资产出现大幅震荡。【原文：The dollar was steady on Wednesday, dragging the yen away from a seven-month peak as currency markets regained a semblance of calm in a week that began with a massive shakeout in assets driven by recession fears and unwinding of popular carry trades.】

item.title: 亚洲股市稍稍站稳脚跟，日经指数仍波澜不惊
item.description: 在华尔街反弹以及对美国经济衰退的担忧被重新评估之后，周三亚洲股市大多走强，但由于波动加剧挤压了杠杆头寸，日本股市出现下跌。【原文：Asian share markets were mostly firmer on Wednesday after Wall Street bounced and concerns about a U.S. recession were reassessed, though Japanese stocks took a dip as heightened volatility squeezed leveraged positions.】

item.title: 美国原油和汽油库存意外增加，油价走低
item.description: 行业数据显示美国原油和汽油库存意外增加，抵消了全球石油供应担忧，油价在上一交易日短暂反弹后，周三亚洲早盘下滑。【原文：Oil prices slipped in early Asian trading on Wednesday following a brief rebound in the previous session after industry data showed an unexpected build in U.S. crude oil and gasoline inventories, offsetting global oil supply concerns.】

item.title: 日本 4 月份日元购买干预创下新的日记录
item.description: 日本周三表示，日本在 4 月份进行了创纪录的单日日元买入干预，卖出了价值 5.92 万亿日元（408.3 亿美元）的美元，以应对当时日元的下跌。【原文：Japan said on Wednesday that it conducted a record single-day yen-buying intervention in April, selling 5.92 trillion yen ($40.83 billion) worth of dollars in a fight against a falling yen at that time.】

item.title: 日本首相候选人石破赞同日本央行加息
item.description: 日本下一任首相的主要潜在候选人支持日本央行逐步提高利率的政策，称其货币政策正常化可推动价格下降并提高工业竞争力。【原文：A prime potential candidate for Japan's next prime minister endorsed the Bank of Japan's policy of gradually raising interest rates, saying its normalisation of monetary policy could push down prices and boost industrial competitiveness.】
